intro: Aeginetia mpomii, commonly known as the Mpomii thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Aeginetia mpomii is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small animals.
